newsitem.title: FRANCE: French port city Marseille hit by transport strike.
newsitem.headline: French port city Marseille hit by transport strike.

text.p: Half of the bus drivers in the Mediterranean port city Marseille walked off the job in a surprise strike on Friday after a driver and an inspector were attacked.
The driver suffered cuts during a confrontation with two knife-wielding men who stole his supply of bus tickets, transit authorities said.
Soon afterwards, an inspector checking tickets on a second bus was struck by a passenger who was later taken inustody, the authorities said.

Separately, in a fresh sign of simmering labour unrest in France, unions representing drivers of armoured cash vans said they planned nationwide strikes on December 23, 24 and 31 to press demands for shorter hours, better working conditions, higher pay and retirement at 55.
The strike call follows a decision by the government to grant retirement at 55 to truck drivers after they set up blockades last month.
Bus drivers in Toulouse, southwestern France, also won the right to retire at 55 after a prolonged strike.
